title: Unable to connect to RANKED games.
body:
I logged on and went to play a ranked game. After champ select I got an unable to connect error and game was remade, (Loss for me)
So I restart and try a normal game. I connect fine.
Thinking the problem was solved, I try another ranked game and get the same error and game is remade. (Now I'm gonna be demoted)
Then I go and do a normal game, and connect fine. Literally only cannot connect to ranked games. 

Is this a known issue or am I alone in my stuggle?
{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} 
The worst part is I can't test my connection without risking another ranked game.

The error
"Unable to connect to the server. please check your network connection and attempt to reconnect to your game."

replies.body: Update, I restarted my computer again, now it's telling me my username and pass is wrong.... I just relogged in the site with my username and password. What can I do?

This specific issue is likely being caused by the patch mismatch we currently have [stickied](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/Oe3XBf34-incorrect-username-or-password).   Your client is on the wrong patch, so it's failing to get you in-game with everyone else.  If a restart didn't help you can download the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) and perform a Force Repatch.  Alternatively, the following manual steps might help as well:

Locate LeagueClientSettings.yaml within C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Open it with a text editor (such as Notepad, TextEdit, or Notepad++) and find gameflow-patcher-lock. It should have a number there.
Change the number to read "null" (without quotes)
Save the file.
Restart the client.
Check server you have checked in log in screen.
